title: Ford and GM announce hundreds of temporary layoffs with no compensation due to strike
description: The two auto companies said the strike is causing supply chain issues that are leading to temporary layoffs of non-striking workers.

title: California sues oil giants, saying they downplayed climate change. Here's what to know
description: California accuses oil companies of misleading the public on the dangers of fossil fuels for decades. The state demands they help fund recovery efforts after climate change-fueled disasters.

title: British media report rape and emotional abuse allegations against Russell Brand
description: The British entertainer denies the allegations, put forward in a join investigation by the the U.K.'s Sunday Times, The Times and Channel 4.

title: Texas Senate acquits state Attorney General Ken Paxton in impeachment trial
description: Paxton, who has been suspended, faced 16 articles of impeachment tied to allegations that he abused his office to protect a political donor. The Senate vote reinstates Paxton as attorney general.

title: Republicans run a big risk with impeachment
description: So far there's been no evidence that President Biden benefited financially from his son's business dealings. And as prior impeachments have shown, Republicans risk a backlash from perceived overreach.

title: Mexico extradites son of former Sinaloa cartel leader 'El Chapo' to the U.S.
description: Ovidio Guzmán López, a son of Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzmán, faces drug trafficking, money laundering and other charges in the United States. Mexican security forces captured Guzmán López in January.

title: DNA tests lower the death toll in Maui fire to 97
description: Officials previously said at least 115 people had died in the fire, but further testing showed they had multiple DNA samples from some of the victims. The number of those who are missing fell to 31.

title: Ohio's Hopewell Ceremonial Earthworks now a UNESCO World Heritage site
description: UNESCO World Heritage Sites are considered "outstanding works of human genius." There are just 24 in the U.S., including the Statue of Liberty and the Grand Canyon.

title: How the UAW strike could have ripple effects across the economy
description: There are several ways the unprecedented United Auto Workers strike could hit the economy, but it will depend on how long the strike lasts and how many plants are affected, among other factors.

title: Oops! I called my boss 'dude.' Career coaches weigh in on tricky workplace dilemmas
description: How to deal with burnout and ageism at work, and what to do when your boss treats you differently because of your political views.

title: 'Dr. Google' meets its match in Dr. ChatGPT
description: In recent research AI has done a credible job at diagnosing health complaints. But should consumers trust unregulated bots with their health care? Doctors see trouble brewing.

title: A Hindu-Muslim dispute tests centuries of interfaith culture in India's Varanasi
description: Both faith communities have long shared this sacred city. But some Hindus have taken legal action over a mosque they claim holds idols of Hindu deities.

title: Hawaii's spirit of aloha helps restore a wildfire-damaged community
description: Native Hawaiians say the aloha spirit is unique — and it's helping them recover.
